triples.name: Compartmental models in epidemiology
triples.relevance: The SIR model is a foundational compartmental model used to track disease transmission and recovery dynamics.

triples.name: COVID-19
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes COVID-19 transmission using mathematical models and Chinese epidemiological data.

triples.name: Spectral radius
triples.relevance: The spectral radius of a matrix is used to determine outbreak conditions, where exceeding 1 indicates disease spread.

triples.name: Basic reproduction number
triples.relevance: The effective reproduction number is analyzed to understand disease transmission rates and intervention impacts.

triples.name: Social distancing
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes social distancing as a public health intervention to reduce disease reproduction numbers.

triples.name: Global cascades model
triples.relevance: The independent cascade model is used to simulate disease propagation through network structures.

triples.name: Configuration model
triples.relevance: Configuration random networks are used to model disease spread through realistic network topology structures.

triples.name: Disease outbreak
triples.relevance: The paper addresses outbreak prediction and characterization using mathematical epidemic models.

triples.name: Time-dependent stochastic model
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel time-dependent SIR model that tracks variable transmission and recovery rates to predict COVID-19 spread.
